snippet: The country’s new prime minister, Bidzina Ivanishvili, said Tuesday that he was making progress on a campaign promise: repairing badly frayed relations with Russia.
abstract: Georgian Prime Min Bidzina Ivanishvili says he is making progress on campaign promise to repair relations with Russia, as Russia takes steps to resume importation of Georgian-produced wine and mineral water; critics of Ivanishvili say his efforts may represent departure from Georgia's efforts to join NATO and European Union.

byline.original: By OLESYA VARTANYAN and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Olesya Vartanyan reported from Tbilisi, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The country’s new prime minister, Bidzina Ivanishvili, said Tuesday that he was making progress on a campaign promise: repairing badly frayed relations with Russia.

headline.seo: Georgia’s Ivanishvili Sees Warming With Russia
headline.main: Georgian Sees Closer Ties With Russia
headline.print_headline: Georgian Sees Closer Ties With Russia
